#Text=Wikinews interviews Australian Paralympic skier Andrew Bor
#Text=Tuesday , December 11 , 2012
#Text=Sunday , Wikinews sat down with Australian Paralympic guide skier Andrew Bor who was participating in a national team training camp in Vail , Colorado .
#Text=Wikinews reporters LauraHale and Hawkeye7 interview Australian Paralympic guide skier Andy Bor
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) ) This is Andrew Bor , who is Melissa Perrine 's guide skier .
#Text=How did you become a guide ?
#Text=Andrew Bor : I was coaching with the team , the September before the games here .
#Text=And the APC [ Australian Paralympic Committee ] found out , I 'm not sure how , sent Melissa out to New Zealand where there was a training camp .
#Text=She did n't have a guide .
#Text=And one of the coaches chose me to guide Mel .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Had you done much guiding before ?
#Text=Andrew Bor : Two days .
#Text=Guided a visually impaired athlete twice before that .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Was there a steep learning curve ?
#Text=Andrew Bor : Yeah , very steep learning curve .
#Text=Still learning .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Is it more difficult as a male guide with a female skier , do you think , because the rules require you to use male ski equipment ?
#Text=Andrew Bor : No. No , I do n't think so .
#Text=I do n't think there 's any issue with that .
#Text=The skis make a different radius turn .
#Text=Sometimes .
#Text=No , I do n't think it makes a huge difference .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) As a guide skier , do you think that guides should be getting medals when their skier gets a medal ?
#Text=Are you that important ?
#Text=Andrew Bor :
#Text=No , I do n't know .
#Text=It 's the athlete 's performance really .
#Text=( ( WN ) )
#Text=But you 're an athlete are n't you ?
#Text=Andrew Bor : No. I 'm their eyes if that makes any sense .
#Text=If they do n't have the commitment to go down the hill , you 're never going to get them to go fast anyway .
#Text=The guide 's responsibility is to put them in the right place .
#Text=But beyond that ...
#Text=( ( WN ) ) You 've gotten support because of the performance in Vancouver ?
#Text=The government has been supporting you guys ?
#Text=Andrew Bor : The government has decided to support the guides as equally as the athletes .
#Text=Before I was employed by the APC , and now I do n't get paid by the APC , I get the same support levels .
#Text=Otherwise , you ca n't do it , you ca n't afford the time .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Why have you chosen skiing as opposed to oh , waterskiing or some other sport ?
#Text=Andrew Bor : I 've worked in this industry for about 20 years .
#Text=Teaching skiing , coaching .
#Text=It 's not something I chose to do , it 's something that kind of happened .
#Text=After a while a door closed , a door opened .
#Text=I enjoy the environment .
#Text=Working outdoors and work in some lovely places .
#Text=You get some great days when there 's blue sky and sunshine and other days in Australia where it might be two degrees and raining .
#Text=But it beats working in an office .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Do you think the classification system for blind skiers works and is a good one ?
#Text=Especially with the factoring issues , and you 're competing with B1 , B2 , B3 , all compete against each other .
#Text=Andrew Bor : Yeah , I do n't know .
#Text=I do n't think there 's a big enough pool of athletes to have three different classes .
#Text=It 's never going to be ideal .
#Text=Different classes have different issues .
#Text=The handicap for the twos and the threes is fairly similar across the different disciplines .

#Text=Maybe the threes have an advantage in the tech because they can see a bit more , but they have a bit of a disadvantage in the speed because they ca n't see enough to see the next gate and have to rely on the guide .
#Text=Bit of a trade off .
#Text=It 's never going to be perfect .
#Text=It 's a tough one .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Are you planning to go to Sochi with Melissa ?
#Text=Andrew Bor : Yes .
#Text=Yes I am .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Do you think you guys have , you and Melissa can pick up a medal , and you get a medal ?
#Text=Andrew Bor : I think Melissa is yeah .
#Text=I think Melissa has a fairly good chance .
#Text=You know , if things fall in place .
#Text=I think she 's got an opportunity to win at least a medal .
#Text=If things do n't fall in place .
#Text=Yeah .
#Text=She might miss out completely .

#Text=( ( WN ) ) Do you plan to continue guide skiing with Melissa for a period following Sochi , or are you going to be like " I 've had enough , I 'm getting old , these mountains are really tall , I 'm going to retire ?
